page.title: 04 Roads in our Area
page.content: Situated at one corner of Britain, no motorways go through our area, though a main road ends here. We have a network of major and minor roads linking our town with Ramsgate and Margate, and leading out of the Isle of Thanet towards Dover, Canterbury and the M2 motorway to London. Many of our local roads are old country lanes which were never widened and are consquently vey congested at times, especially in summer when holiday makers are in Thanet. Some newer roads are wider, and were built to bypass the old village areas. One road, the Dane Court Road, is being widened at the moment. It was a very bad road, without pavements, narrow and with a nasty bend close by a farm. Many accidents have occurred along this road, which had a badly potholed surface for many years.
